titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Samuel Bland, Indictment
CWG9775

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Breckinridge Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
Samuel Bland
The Grand Jury of Breckinridge County, in the name & by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Samuel Bland of the Offense of keeping a Tippling house -- committed as follows viz=
The said Samuel Bland on the first day of May 1859, and divers days since, in the County aforesaid, kept a tippling house against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.
Cicero Maxwell Atty for the Commonwealth

Witnesses
John C. Wheatly
John H. Blake
Geo. W. Wheatly
Wm Blake

A copy
Att R. H. Bourner D. C.
G P Jolly clk

Commonwealth
vs } Copy Indictment
Samuel Bland
